args: Sorry to rope you into running errands for\nthe village.
Besides, it's a good opportunity to learn\nmore about the sylvans.
We just need to deliver these herbs from\nthe village to the apothecary up ahead.
Once we're done, we can wander the town\nand have a bit of fun.
So your people do have contact with folks\noutside the forest, then.
Of course. For example, we trade surplus\nitems for coin we can use to buy things\nwe can't get in the forest.
Our village would manage just fine without\nit, but it IS convenient.
Hello, Luca. I appreciate you coming\nout here.
You didn't have to wait for me.
Huh. I didn't realize there were sylvans\nliving outside the forest as well.
Most still spend their whole lives in the\nwoods, but recent years have seen some\nhead out into the world to find work.
We're skilled herbalists, and we tend to\nbe better at manipulating mana than other\nraces as well.
So some sylvans have found employment\nas doctors and mages and the like.
Much of what sylvans take for common\nknowledge about medicinal herbs is news\nto human ears.
I'd like to apply what I know to help\nadvance the state of medicine in Grastaea.
I think that's a fine idea.
Which is why I brought you a little\nsouvenir from the village. Enjoy.
B-but it is forbidden to take this out of the\nvillage, Luca!
One of many musty old rules that I\ndiligently ignore.
And more of us should do the same.
It's a waste to let perfectly good medicine\nsit unused in the village.
You're doing research into a number of\nsupposedly untreatable diseases, yes?\nWhich means you need this.
But if they find out what you've done,\nyou'll be punished.
It wouldn't be the first time, nor the last.
After a lifetime of mischief, I'm not afraid\nof another lecture from an elder.
They are woefully out of touch.
More and more of us are leaving the\nvillage, and we need to start bringing\nmore of the outside world back.
That benefits both sides, don't you think?
Now stop grousing and take it already.
You've actually given this some serious\nthought, Luca. I'm surprised.
Tch! Rude. What's so surprising about it?\nI'm a serious fellow. A thinker, if you will.
I'm always trying to find ways to make life\nbetter—for sylvans and everyone else.
So, um... Do you have that item I asked\nyou about?
Yes, and it is most effective. My abs still\nhurt from laughing. ...Here you are.
Wait. Do you have a DOCTOR inventing\npranking tools for you?!
Also, didn't you JUST get in trouble for\nthis the other day?
Which is why they'll never expect it now!
Aww, afraid of getting in trouble?\nYou'll never enjoy life like that.
Sometimes you have to let the pranking\nimpulse take you where it may!
And just WHERE is this impulse taking\nyou now, Luca?
S-Sarisse?! How did... Er...\nWh-what brings you here?
An errand for Cleo. Now then, what ARE\nyou holding? I'm veeery curious.
That's not like you at all. You're always so\nbold and direct—I respect that about you!
Wait, no, hold up! ...Whew!\nAlmost spoiled the whole plan there.
I thought you were supposed to let the\nimpulse take you or whatever?
I admire that about you, remember?\nThe way you dash off on adventures is\nEVER so impressive.
Come ooon. You know you want to\nshow me what you have...
I'm sooo ready to be impressed, Luca.\nPleeease?
I guess I have no choice!\nSo...here.
...This is a smoke bomb.\n...A CHUCKLEBERRY smoke bomb.
Right. So you clearly learned NOTHING\nfrom the last time.
When are you going to grow up,\nyou big idiot?! HAAAH!
Grrnghf! I-I give up! I was wrong!\nM-mercy!
Luca?! Are you all right?! ...He's out cold!
